questions.title: Black Box: Tests do not care how it is done, they test what is done.
Public API: Tests cover all methods in public API.
Readable: Tests are written in understandable language to make for easy understanding / debugging.
Line Coverage: line coverage is at least 80%.
Branch Coverage: Branch coverage is at least 80%.
Self-Contained: Tests do not rely on global state, or other test suites, in order to pass.
Positive Testing: Tests account for the expected use of your code.
Negative Testing: Tests simulate unexpected and/or error scenarios and code handles them gracefully.
No Ignores: No tests are “X-ed” out or commented out.
Don’t Test 3rd-Party Code: Your tests don’t test third-party code; that code should come with its own tests.
Does a test for this issue exist?
Where do we need to test?
